intro: Belencita hagenii, commonly known as the Hagen's belencita, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Belencita hagenii is often found in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions.
